conclusion: An object A with mass 2m is connected to an object B with mass 3m on the ground via a light spring with a spring constant k.
An inextensible light rope passes over a fixed pulley, with one end connected to object A and the other end connected to an object C with mass m.
Objects A, B, and C are all in a state of rest. The gravitational acceleration is g, and all friction is neglected.
Change the mass of object C to 5m. At this point, C slowly descends, and after some time, the system reaches a new equilibrium state.
At this time, B still does not leave the ground, and C is only subjected to gravity and the tension of the rope.
Find the height that object A rises during this process.
The image shows three objects connected by a spring and a rope. Object A has a mass of 2m, object B has a mass of 3m, and object C has a mass of 5m.
The spring connects objects A and B, and the rope, which passes over a pulley, connects objects A and C.
The system is initially at rest.
Initially, the system is at rest, so the net force acting on it is zero.
After changing the mass of object C to 5m, object C descends, and the system reaches a new equilibrium state.
At this new equilibrium, the spring's extension is x, and the vertical displacement of object A is y.
The spring force is given by kx.
The weight of object A is (2m)g, and the weight of object C is (5m)g.
In equilibrium, the tension T in the rope must satisfy the equation: T - (2m)g - kx = 0 and T - (5m)g = 0.
Solving these equations, we get: kx = (5m - 2m)g = 3mg.
Therefore, the height that object A rises is y.
